intro: Oreocharis humilis, commonly known as the small oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive pattern resembling the cookie of the same name. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oreocharis humilis is considered a rare and endangered species.
